title: Stroke admission [Diagnostic plan]
content:
[Brain imaging]
- Brain MRI without contrast for better visualization of infarct territory and size

[Risk factor investigation]
- Make sure CBC, basic chemistry, EKG, CXR been done
- Check lipid and sugar profile and HbA1c
- Arrange extracranial carotid and transcranial color duplex,
- Arrange echocardiography, Holter monitor (24h) 

- Young stroke survey: hypercoagulopathy, vasculitis, genetic causes

title: Stroke admission [Educational plan]
content:
Explain the plan after admission.
Inform the patient about the high risk of recurrent stroke during the acute phase and warn them about the red flag signs.
Explore available community support services and transportation options.

title: Stroke admission [Therapeutic plan]
content:
[Antithrombotic therapy]
- Aspirin  Clopidogrel  for secondary stroke prevention

[Monitor of neurological and other clinical status]
- Evaluate GCS coma scale, muscle strength, pupil size QID and PRN
- Check finger sugar regularly, and keep it under 200 mg/dL
- Check vital signs. Not to decrease BP unless BP high than 180/110 mmHg. 
- Complete bedside swallow examination. Repeat it if necessary
- Follow up brain imaging if NIHSS drop (or more than 4)

[Others]
- Use short-acting antihypertensive agent if we need to lower the BP 
- Consider isotonic fluid for volume expansion if necessary with close monitoring of fluid status 
- Consult rehabilitation within 72 hours
